intro: Svenkoeltzia patriciae, commonly known as the Patricia's sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. Native to specific regions in South America, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
